reviews: these work great even though i do not have an iphone, i use them with my android phone and i was worried about compatibility issues but gratefully i did not come across any. i got them over the other in-ear headphones because my ear starts to ache if something is inside it too long. these are perfect as they stay just near the outer part allowing my inner ear to get some breathing space. sound quality is great as expected from the brand however the noise cancelling could be better. but that is a price to pay for my ear to not be fully closed off. a lot of the advertised features do not work because i am not using an iphone (such as siri, ear detection or even battery detection - which can be frustrating). but here are some features that did work:- you cannot double tap to get to siri (or google) but the double tap instead works to pause or play the media!- you can still use just one earphone since they both connect differently. (will need to change settings to allow for mono audio, this can be found in accessibility).

reviews: they sound great, are easy to charge and store, the batteries last a very long time, and the noise canceling feature works very well. they are really easy to connect to any device too. but they have a tendency to fall out of my ear, and that costs them a star. maybe it is just my particular ears, but almost every time i use them, one manages to fall out and hit the ground at some point. because of that, i have to be careful where i use them. motorcycle rides and river activities are out of the question. once one fell out while i was on the riding mower, and it took me about ten very stressful minutes to find it. i have since learned that it helps to wrap a bandanna around my head and ears when mowing. unfortunately this is not a perfect solution either, as the other day one still managed to fall out and hit the ground when mowing. fortunately i found it right away that time.thank goodness they certainly do seem to be very durable. my kid is airpod pros got washed and dried, and they still worked! i heard them clanking around in the drier for  minutes, but thought it was just a nickel or something.anyway, for around the house or office they are great. but do not think you can trust them to go anywhere.

reviews: i had recently purchased the apple airpods nd generation, and while i am happy with my purchase, there are some elements of the design, function and use that bother me, needless to say i feel happy with my purchase. as this generation is not the newest, some of my complaints have been addressed through the new release of the next generation of apple airpods, however, that brings me to my first issue, cost. the price of these earphones, even being out of date is still significantly higher than competitors with a range of  -  usd.  furthermore, with the design of the airpods, and the hard shell they come in, after using the product for a significant amount of time, they start to hurt your ears and make them sore. this is counterproductive from their main function and design, with their wireless capabilities and small design meant to not only fit snugly, but be able to be forgotten about. with the amount of substitute goods on the market, there are clearly a wide range of options to choose from. so why did i choose to buy the apple airpods?when this product first came out, the high price and novelty was somewhat justified, as this was a big step in change for apple, as well, they had just gotten rid of their headphone jack in their phones, almost forcing people to switch over to different headphones. as well the sound quality was incredibly clear and the airpods allowed you to wear them for hours on end with just one charge. one of the biggest things i love about the airpods is how easy it is to transfer them, there are no cords to get tangled and they come in a small case. what really convinced me to invest in these earphones though was a friend of mine, sarah, when she explained how she loved to go on walks and runs with them, and they do not fall out and make for a very fun experience. she encouraged me to get the airpods because they are a great benefit not only for your class, but also just for your every day life. i am not the biggest runner but i do love to go on outdoor hikes with my dog, and so after hearing her review i went out to go purchase a pair.

reviews: i wanted to try some of these and when they had a good price here on amazon i went ahead and purchased a pair  i was not prepared to pay the price for the newest version. i also have a set of beats earbuds which are very nice and probably fit my ear a bit better but that is mainly because they sort of twist into your ear. these being a different thing altogether, where they slide into your ear and hang there is nice because they do not pop out, on the other hand the sound quality is going to work better if they fit tightly in your ear versus loosely so a lot of that is is going to depend on the individual. they have fine audio reproduction but as you might expect with such small speakers the base is a bit light and the noise cancellation seems to work but it is only going to work if there is a good seal around the earbud and the ear itself so once again that is going to depend on your ear. they are slightly larger than some but i did not find that to be a problem. they  work well in a work out, mainly because if you are going to use earbuds and are using ones that fit tightly into your ear, like beats, they are more likely to work their way out during your exercise program as you move your head and so forth. if they seem a good price you cannot go wrong

reviews: airpods second generation is wireless bluetooth earbuds designed by apple inc. they are white wireless earbuds that come inside a case that uses bluetooth from your phone. you can watch videos, listen to music, or even hear anything that comes from your phone. they know when they are inserted in your ear and are ready to work as soon as you put them in, and additionally, they will pause audio automatically when you remove them. the product is really easy to use. all you have to do is put them in your ear, go to your setting and connect them to your phone, and play whatever you like from your phone.  i have had this product for  years now and i still love them even though they come out with new ones almost every year or . my experience with airpods has been great. i have not ever had a problem with my airpods. i feel like the second generation is enough for me because all the generations work the same, they just get better and louder, and since i have had them for so long i think it is time for me to upgrade and get new ones. everybody i know uses this product, and they love them. airpods are really popular in the teenage world, almost every teenager has a pair of airpods, and loves them.  air pods sound fantastic for their size, and the battery life for the airpods alone are great for their size, the charging case battery life is actually  times better than the airpods battery life to me the charging case stays charged longer than the actual airpods. airpods have an amazing microphone, you can talk to siri through airpods, and make phone calls, and have amazing sound. they do not only connect from your iphone but they can connect from your ipad, or apple watch as well, which is great for when you do not have your phone but still want to listen to music.  there are not many cons with airpods, but there are a few. air pods are really tiny, but that does not affect the sound in any way, it only affects if it will stay in your ear for so long, or if they do not fit your ears at all, because a lot of people tend to have a problem with them not fitting in everyone is ears, and since they are so tiny, it is really easy for them to get lost or misplaced definitely if they fall out of your ear and you do not even notice that they have fallen out. they are also easy to get misplaced if you do not put them back into the case right away after using them. all apple products are pretty much waterproof, but i feel like this is the only product that is not waterproof, and if they keep improving and making better ones they should all be waterproof. airpods are not good for athletes, or for people who just like to work out because if you are doing a lot of moving with these airpods in your ear  times out of  they will fall out.  i highly recommend someone to buy airpods. they are good for everyone. if you are just chilling, or just love music, or want to talk on the phone they are really convenient to people who do not like holding their phones up to their ear when they talk. as i said before, everyone i know around me has airpods and they are definitely great for teenagers. they will be a wonderful gift for someone, they are worth the price because the sound is amazing and they close out everything else around you.

reviews: i waited a long, long time before buying apple ear pods. i have used skull candy, soundpeats, and a host of others. they all have their little quirks and variations. the apple ones do as well, but not nearly as many. overall, the quality of these is awesome. the sound is great, it allows for pass through sound so i can listen to music and still hear whats going on around me, and the charge lasts for several hours.the downside(s). first, my ears do not necessarily fit these (or the wired ones that always came with the iphones), so i have to adjust and push these in every once in a while. i know thats why they came out with the pro ones with the plastic ear bud. those will be the next pair i get. secondly, live listen works great, with one caveat. i would have imagined that the mic used would have been the mics on the ear buds themselves. nope. it uses your phone mic. so, if you put your phone in your pocket and have live listen on, you hear the phone shuffling around in your pocket. in other words, you have to leave your phone out (laying on your desk, holding it in your hand, etc.) in order to use it with any success. maybe that changes on other models, but for these, it makes the live listen almost pointless. i want to be hands free, with my phone in my pocket, but be able to hear someone if they talk to me. not sure what else the concept would have been used for in using the phone mic.other than those issues, i really have no complaints. the case charges the pods quickly and multiple times, so you can continue to use them for a long time. again, sound quality is as good, if not better, than any other ear buds ive used. you can set what the functions are, so tapping the right ear twice can mean whatever you want versus tapping the left ear twice.i am really pleased with these and would recommend them.
cleaned_review: waited long long time buying ear pod used skull candy soundpeats host others little quirk variation one well nearly many overall quality awesome sound great allows pas sound listen music still hear whats going around charge last several hoursthe downside first ear necessarily fit wired one always came iphones adjust push every know thats came pro one plastic ear bud next pair get secondly live listen work great caveat would imagined mic used would mics ear bud nope us phone mic put phone pocket live listen hear phone shuffling around pocket word leave phone laying desk holding hand etc order use success maybe change model make live listen almost pointless want hand free phone pocket able hear someone talk sure else concept would used using phone micother issue really complaint case charge pod quickly multiple time continue use long time sound quality good better ear bud ive used set function tapping ear twice mean whatever want versus tapping ear twicei really pleased would recommend

reviews: ah yes, the nd generation airpods from apple that we have all been eyeing now. i will keep it short - it plays sound quite nicely, with sufficient bass and crystal clear sound from all octaves and ranges. the sound quality and everything is practically perfect. it pairs effortlessly with any compatible apple device (i have an iphone) and it pairs almost before i put it in my ears. never knew not going to the bluetooth settings would be such a much-needed life-changing convenience.the only complaint is the noise cancellation. it does not have any whatsoever. do not even think there will be 'a little', because there is absolutely none. if you are in a loud environment and you are struggling to hear your music, your only real solution is to either find a quieter place or turn up the volume and hope you do not go deaf. if there was noise cancellation (airpods pro has them now), then it would be a perfect product. it is a minor inconvenience that makes it feel not worth the price. to people who think it may not be a problem, then this is the product for you. otherwise, go bump your purchase to the pros.

reviews: i have tried (and still use) the entire family of airpods.  they all have their perks.  these airpods (g) are compact, and reasonable with decent sound quality.  the g is are a just bit better, in my opinion, but i found out the hard way that long listening sessions (like all day, in a zoom meeting) left my ears feeling a bit sore due to the new shape, whereas the g do not do that, at all.the ap pros have the best sound, hands down. however, after awhile, i cannot tolerate the feeling of the insert in my ear, so i can only listen for an hour or so, then i need to rest my ears.so, when you break it down, there is simply a compromise of sound quality vs. ear comfort.  so, for me, for long listening sessions, phone calls, audio books, virtual meetings, audio privacy whilst you listen to videos and whatnot, etc. the gen are my favorite. they are also the most pocketable, and for the current price, the g are tough to say no to.

reviews: update: i exchanged the defective first pair for a new pair. the new pair paired with my phone quickly, and actually they have really good sound. they work well with my iphone and if i have my ipad nearby they will pair to that easily.they seem to stay in my ear well, the sound is crisp and clear and the bass is even decent. i wanted an option to have earbuds that didnt totally block out the outside world that way people will not yell at me at home and i will not hear them.this type of earbud that is not isolating actually is easier to use for dictation and phone calls. the ones that seal tight in your ears are muddy and have skull resonance that makes it hard to make phone calls.i am not sure of the long-term durability yet, and i am really considering buying the applecare protection just in case this new pair has problems. i am upping the review to five stars.original review: only two stars.now that the price has come down, i decided to try a set of these nd gen. airpods. i got an authentic, new pair, they have nice finish and feel, and the pairing details shows i can buy the applecare extended warranty, so i do not believe they are fake.i followed the setup instructions, but it only paired one earbud. the other was staticky and then had no audio. when i took out one earpod and put the other in, waited couple seconds, that one has audio. then when put the second one in, there is only stereo audio for perhaps - seconds, then one ear gets staticky or drops signal, then just one earpod.i spent the next  or  minutes (or maybe an hour) 'forgetting' the earpods, resetting the case, re-pairing them, it has the same problems. i have multiple other bluetooth earbuds, headphones, etc., and have not had problems like this. i followed the instructions from apple to the letter, and searched other websites for ideas.they just will not play both earbuds at the same time. the signal also loses connection and has signal interruptions, static, loss.when they do play together, the sound is very good to me, clear, with some bass, and they fit in my ears well. i wanted to try a pair of these so that i can hear ambient noise around me and people, other kinds i have seal tight and you cannot hear anything around you (and also phone calls are harder to make since you cannot hear your own voice as well.)i am going to order another set and see if that one will work properly. for $, and the $ extra, these airpods should work perfectly and without all these issues.i have, for instance,  other sets of taotronics earbuds and they work flawlessly and easily, and they were only $ each. the apple earbuds are triple that cost and cannot do a basic pairing to my iphone .if the second set does not work correctly, i will just pass and go with a different company.
cleaned_review: update exchanged defective first pair new pair new pair paired phone quickly actually really good sound work well iphone ipad nearby pair easilythey seem stay ear well sound crisp clear bass even decent wanted option earbuds didnt totally block outside world way people yell home hear themthis type earbud isolating actually easier use dictation phone call one seal tight ear muddy skull resonance make hard make phone callsi sure longterm durability yet really considering buying applecare protection case new pair problem upping review five starsoriginal review two starsnow price come decided try set nd gen got authentic new pair nice finish feel pairing detail show buy applecare extended warranty believe fakei followed setup instruction paired earbud staticky audio took earpod put waited couple second audio put second stereo audio perhaps second ear get staticky drop signal earpodi spent next minute maybe hour forgetting earpods resetting case repairing problem multiple bluetooth earbuds headphone etc problem like followed instruction letter searched website ideasthey play earbuds time signal also loses connection signal interruption static losswhen play together sound good clear bass fit ear well wanted try pair hear ambient noise around people kind seal tight hear anything around also phone call harder make since hear voice welli going order another set see work properly extra work perfectly without issuesi instance set taotronics earbuds work flawlessly easily earbuds triple cost basic pairing iphone second set work correctly pas go different company

reviews: these wireless earbuds are amazing. they have a smooth connection to your phone and the possibilities of what they can assist you in, in your everyday life to make things easier are endless. they make listening to music, podcasts, phone calls, and talking to siri almost effortless. the nd generation apple airpods automatically connect to your phone through bluetooth first thing when you open the wireless charging case. the wireless charging case charges your airpods just by inserting them into their spots and closing the case. by charging your airpods in the case for just fifteen minutes you have up to  hours of battery life in each airpod. another feature that comes with the airpods is being able to customize certain things of the wireless earbuds to how you would like them. there are two ways you can customize them. the first one is by choosing what you would like engraved on the case. the options of what you can engrave on them is limitless. some common things people engrave on them are their name, phone number in case they were to lose them, or a favorite quote. the other way you can customize them is by the name you want them under. when your airpods connect to your phone, it shows the name they are under on your phone screen and you can choose what youd like that name to be. i love my nd generation apple airpods and i cant say enough good things about them. if you are looking for a reliable wireless earbud, these are definitely for you.

reviews: i did not know if these were worth the money considering that these seemed like glorified regular earbuds. i actually like these better. while the price is high, it seems worth it in my couple months of owning them. i got these for my first semester at college to ignore people and listen to bomb ass music without looking too broke. first off, these are pretty good with noise canceling. i can hear people sometimes if the music is low enough, but the sound is more muffled. it is great when i want to pay attention to my work or ignore people as they tune out people and they also make it a universal sign of "do not talk to me" which is great when i do not want to talk to others in public. even if i am not listening to music! the other great thing is the fact that it is quick to charge and the battery life is pretty good!in comparison to regular earbuds or even headphones is the fact that they are easy to pack and easy to access. headphones are bulky and generally awkward (for me at least) to have around the neck. however, airpods are really easy to put in and then when you are done using them, you put them back in the small compact case. another is the lack of wire. i do not know about you, but for me the lack of wire is much easier. when i am in the mood to listen to something with my earbuds, i no longer need to un-knot the earbuds but simply take them out of the case. so like i said, i really like these and enjoy the easy access and the small compactness of this as well as the increase in sound quality and battery life. if i could rate this out of , i would give it an honest .

reviews: i got these as a gift from my daughters and could not be happier. the sound quality is great! i use them for phone hands free driving, multi tasking while on the phone, work calls etc. as well as for music. they sound great and the feedback from other callers is excellent as far as how i sound. i can hear the caller and my music perfectly and they have great dynamic range for music.  the noise cancellation issue is a trade off that i rated fairly at a  but that is not a negative. these fit loosely so that makes them extremely comfortable to wear and just about forget they are on for long periods of time. however, the fact that they are loose fitting does allow other noise to enter. this is a positive if you are in the car, have other people that may speak to you from time to time while you are wearing them etc. to me these are a great balance. i have another brand that i have had for years that fit really tightly and while they block out ambient noise they are also less comfortable and it is really hard to have them on while other people are around or you are needing to hear anything at all except the headphones. to me this is a great balance and i am extremely pleased with these!

reviews: real airpods are  stars, but amazon is filled with fake airpods, and the ones i received were not obvious. i saw a review here of someone who had trouble with their new airpods, brought it in to apple for fixing, and the apple repair team concluded it was a high quality knockoff. turns out i am a victim as well.it is like someone gutted a real pair of airpods, replaced the internals with cheap knockoffs and put it back together. everything with my "airpods" was identical and seemed brand new. plastic wrap was around the oem box (pretty easy to fake nowadays, but still impressive nontheless). everything was immaculate just like a new box of airpods, oem feeling cable, etc. the feel, touch, glue, placement of holes and patterns of the airpods seemed identical to my older airpods multistop  the biggest clue was audio quality. the audio quality was considerably worse than regular airpods. it was noticeable right off the bat, especially when talking with other people. it was especially obvious since i still have my old gen  airpods to compare with multistop  bluetooth was very unstable. leaving more then  feet away from my bluetooth adapter made it go haywire and produced a lot of static. it would also randomly go offsync with the left and right earbuds when listening with both of them on multistop  battery life. they lasted about - hours before the battery died on them. not much else to say about this, just way lower battery life than new airpods should have.interesting thing to note, the apple limited warranty should not be used as a metric to see if it is legit. the first thing i checked was to see if these fake airpods had warranty, which it said i had  year starting from the day i paired it with my iphone //. i thought this assured me that i had a legit pair of airpods. once i concluded the new airpods were fake, i did some testing and all i did was put my real old airpods with the new fake airpod charging case, and now my old airpods purchased in  said i have  year of warranty starting on //.conclusion: buyer beware, high effort airpods seem to plague amazon. if you want to save ~$ bucks and roll the dice get these on amazon. if you do not want to take the risk of dealing with this headache, just buy it directly off apple.
cleaned_review: real star amazon filled fake one received obvious saw review someone trouble new brought fixing repair team concluded high quality knockoff turn victim wellit like someone gutted real pair replaced internals cheap knockoff put back together everything identical seemed brand new plastic wrap around oem box pretty easy fake nowadays still impressive nontheless everything immaculate like new box oem feeling cable etc feel touch glue placement hole pattern seemed identical older multistop biggest clue audio quality audio quality considerably worse regular noticeable bat especially talking people especially obvious since still old gen compare multistop bluetooth unstable leaving foot away bluetooth adapter made go haywire produced lot static would also randomly go offsync earbuds listening multistop battery life lasted hour battery died much else say way lower battery life new haveinteresting thing note limited warranty used metric see legit first thing checked see fake warranty said year starting day paired iphone thought assured legit pair concluded new fake testing put real old new fake airpod charging case old purchased said year warranty starting conclusion buyer beware high effort seem plague amazon want save buck roll dice get amazon want take risk dealing headache buy directly

reviews: i have always worn an earbud in my ear.  i am a working mom who is always on the go, always on the move, and always working.  i love to listen to music or audible while working, driving, house chores, etc., and because of this, you will always find one earbud in my ear at all times.  i have been a huge apple fan for years now, but i am getting tired of the dying of products after a year or so.i had a previous pair of airpods, and literally after one year of use (please keep in mind i wear these everyday), no one can hear me.  i can hear everything anyone says, but no one can hear me on either airpod.  my tapping to start and stop audio has failed in one pod also.  i assumed they were dirty, and had someone clean them, but no amount of cleaning would get the other person to hear me.  so on to  set of airpods.  again, a year later, same issue.  i can hear fine, but no one can hear me.  tapping to start and stop is starting to fail again also.i love my airpods, like the fit as i am a small female, and these have never fallen out of my ears, and i can wear them all day in relative comfort.  but i am over spending money on expensive earbuds that die a year later.i think i am going to try the samsung earbuds this time around, and see if i cannot get some lasting ability with those.

reviews: i ordered these on prime day from amazon. the pro was i received them within hours of ordering.the con, as with many name brand items on amazon im not sure why the quality you get on amazon is always so much different than what you get at actual large retailers but its always a different quality. one of the buds wouldnt pair automatically nor did it make a sound letting me know it was connected. troubleshot the pod with amazon tech support and then it started working but the other went out. long story short, purchase from apple or target or maybe even walmart.as for the pods themselves, i would recommend getting the pro. these are cute and stylish and you can listen to music or videos or whatever but there is zero noise cancellation. like zero. i got them mainly for work so when im working i can tune out noise but absolutely no, i can hear everything around me. they fit well and the overall sound quality is good for whats its worth but they are not the best by any means. they are convenient. i think the battery is pretty good. they stay in place. but if youre looking for the best sound or noise cancelling, skip these. if youre looking to save a little money but want a good quality bluetooth earbud set by a trusted brand then get these. do not waste your money on the $- no names cause they typically do not fit well and have connectivity issues.

reviews: the sound quality is just fine. i like the ease of function by tapping. and i like how quickly they charge. only about  mins for another  to  hours use. but i have two main issues with these. i use mine at work all day. i have them in on average of  to  hours a day. i found that after that amount of usage, it wasnt long before the hard plastic made my ears extremely sore. there were times i couldnt use them because they hurt my ears too much. i realize i probably use them more than the average person. second, the mic stopped working just a few days after my warranty expired. that was a total bummer. i could no longer use them for voice calls. all that said, i do like apple products. i purchased the pros with extended warranty. hopefully i fare better with them.

reviews: overall, sound is fine. theyre just earbuds so i do not expect audiophile levels of sound quality or any noise cancellation. but for an apple product, these things have far too many bugs for their price.these things are terrible outdoors or in very large spaces. they will cutout and disconnect, because im assuming the signal is too weak and doesnt have anything to bounce off of. that makes them basically useless for the outdoors or in wide open spaces, like large atriums or gyms. i can really only expect to use these in the home or office, which meant i had to buy another pair of headphones that worked outdoors. its a bit ridiculous.speaking of home and office use, the mic does not work well at all, and is unusable for phone calls, video/zoom calls, etc. so again, i have to switch to a headset or my other pair of headphones for that, since people cannot hear me if i attempt to use these.on top of that, they also have issues with ear detection and randomly disconnecting from my iphone. ill be wearing them, listening to whatever, and suddenly they just drop the connection, as if i took them out of my ear. the only way to get it working again is to place it back into the case and take them out again and place them back in your ear. its very annoying and happens almost every time i use them.ive used two pairs since , and both have had these issues. ive only used them with other apple products, multiple iphones and an ipad, so i know its not a device compatibility or bluetooth issue.my oldest pair has almost no battery life left, and is only useable for less than an hour at a time, so do not expect these things to last more than a few years either.in conclusion, these have always felt like a step backward from a classic pair of wired earbuds. sure, theyre wireless, but it just feels so much less usable in so many different ways, while being  times the cost. apple needs to seriously step up their wireless earbuds game if they insist on moving away from wired connections and forcing us to use the garbage pods.

reviews: it has been quite a while since i have bought a set of apple earbuds to use as my primary form of listen-wear. i truly miss the design of the apple earbuds from the pre- ipod days. i used the heck out of them as a kid, and thought the nd generation airpods would hopefully be the closest thing to that. for me, they are not multistop sound quality is as good as i always thought the apple headphones were, nothing really lost there.battery life is fantastic, though admittedly, i have not really charged them since i initially charged them when i first got them and it is been several days (not continuous use) multistop so multistop take that for what it is worth multistop comfort is the absolute biggest miss here. you have to shove these things down into your ear to get optimal hearing and my ears are not a fan of that. if you look up the external parts of the ear, the "helix crus" part of my outer ear is so irritated that once i take the airpods out, there is no way they are going back in. (so just leave them in then) multistop well multistop that is not always possible, and because they hurt so much, i find myself trying to adjust to make them more comfortable, and that just does not work.(so get some earbud cushions multistop ) got 'em multistop i got a whole pack of  or so from amazon that people were adamant would make the airpods more comfortable based on their own experience multistop did not work. you could say in some regard that they helped to some degree, but they definitely did not take away the uncomfortability of the  airpods, and if it does not eliminate the comfort issue completely, they might as well not even be there multistop (could it just be your ears multistop ?) yes, it absolutely could just be my ears. ears come in all different sizes and some may not even notice these things are in their ears - that is what i was hoping for multistop but sadly did not achieve. perhaps if there was a smaller pair, the discomfort may not be such a problem, but obviously that is illogical.i also had an issue with getting the sound to play on them from my phone. bluetooth was enabled, airpods were showing as "connected", but the sound would not switch from my phone speaker to the airpods. i cannot remember what all i had to do in order to finagle that multistop but it took some doing, and no other non-apple product that i have ever used has had this issue multistop and if you research it, it sounds like it is a common issue with no real straight-forward resolution.it is truly a shame. i could have done with lesser quality sound and even poorer battery life in exchange for greater comfort. apple hits the mark on just about everything here except that one very important aspect, so buy at your own risk. i probably will not be using these the way that i thought i was going to be because of it multistop   $ down multistop

reviews: let me start by saying our family buys lots of apple products. add that with the fact that having wireless earbuds are so convenient and apple appears to makes a slick product. the airpods fit fine for me and my spouse. the case is also very small, but the earbuds could have smaller stems. the sound quality is good, but not excellent. however, both sets we purchased had one earbud die within . years. i talked with a friend and they said the same thing happened to them. combine that with some negatives such as the high price, average battery life, the fact that these arent noise canceling, the annoyance that having a family sharing apple account combines all earbuds into everyones devices causing a lot of accidental switching of airplay, and you have a very expensive recurring cost per year per person. i thought about how a warranty might help, but you still have to pay for warranty plus the replacement parts and can only replace  parts. buying a new pair would have ended up being the same cost for us or even cheaper with the airpods on sale. maybe the gen s will be more reliable but im not paying almost $ to find out. my advice for most people, buy the off brands that come with an  month warranty and more features like double the battery life and controls. they will run as low as $ and will probably be good enough. you can reward yourself with a music subscription using the money youll save.

reviews: i got these for free directly from apple and that is the only reason i have them. i knew i would never buy these -- just from the looks of the all hard plastic design i knew they would be a poor fit, especially being that there is no silicone tip to stay gripped in the ears and to provide a good seal for the best sound possible. what i feared is exactly what i experienced when i got to use these.it integrates nicely with other apple devices, and is also able to connect to non-apple devices as well. sound is good with initial ear-seating, but it quickly loses seal and starts to fall out -- this is when i am just sitting still. what is the point of having great technology if it cannot be used? also, what is with the lightning port instead of the standard usb when apple has so much concern over plastic waste? side note : the whole trend of eliminating headphone jacks and forcing customers to purchase wireless headphones and/or accessories to use existing headphones already owned by customers fully contradicts apple is advertised concern for waste reduction. all it does is it increases apple is profit with our money and takes away our choices. also now you have copycats like samsung and others doing the same -- end of side note.i guess since it has apple is name, too many people blindly rate  stars no matter what. i will give them / stars for their marketing strategies. the price is just plain funny but i guess that is the new normal. the airpod pros are the practical choice if one was deciding on only airpods, but at that price it is a bit too much considering other available options.
cleaned_review: got free directly reason knew would never buy look hard plastic design knew would poor fit especially silicone tip stay gripped ear provide good seal best sound possible feared exactly experienced got use theseit integrates nicely device also able connect nonapple device well sound good initial earseating quickly loses seal start fall sitting still point great technology used also lightning port instead standard usb much concern plastic waste side note whole trend eliminating headphone jack forcing customer purchase wireless headphone andor accessory use existing headphone already owned customer fully contradicts advertised concern waste reduction increase profit money take away choice also copycat like samsung others end side notei guess since name many people blindly rate star matter give star marketing strategy price plain funny guess new normal airpod pro practical choice deciding price bit much considering available option

reviews: my little  year old nephew wanted the first generation airpod for his birthday but his parents thought they were a waste of money, so i got them for him behind his parents' backs and he loves them.they operated well until approximately a month ago. at that point, the right earbud microphone started to malfunction and would no longer detect sound until he yelled. i phoned apple customer service and went over all of the possible remedies, such as upgrading to the most recent ios and checking that the airpods were running the most recent firmware. when customer service was unable to remedy the issue, they advised me to send the airpods in for repair. i received a fedex shipment box and label and made them an offer for repair. the airpods were returned to me approximately three days later, along with a message from the technicians claiming that there was nothing wrong with them.i then tested them on my phone and my wife is phone, and the right microphone on both phones would only detect sound at a very high volume, but the sound was still garbled. i phoned apple is customer service department once more. the representative advised that i take the airpods to the local apple store and explain the problem to a professional there. unfortunately, the nearest apple store was an hour away from my house, however the agent did not appear to find this to be an issue.i expressed my unhappiness with having to drive  hours round trip to fix a $ equipment, and i inquired as to why i could not send them back for repair while determining the specific problem. the agent agreed to send another shipping box and note that the problem was with the right microphone on the repair ticket. i got another package, sent the airpods in for repair a second time, and waited. they gave them back to me and said there was nothing wrong with them. and, once again, the right microphone is not working properly.at this point, i am left wondering why the "world is most valuable company" would consider it appropriate to force a client to spend  hours of my time repairing apple is product rather than just shipping a new pair and keeping the consumer satisfied. apple is customer service has tarnished what might have been a fantastic device.
cleaned_review: little year old nephew wanted first generation airpod birthday parent thought waste money got behind parent back love themthey operated well approximately month ago point earbud microphone started malfunction would longer detect sound yelled phoned customer service went possible remedy upgrading recent io checking running recent firmware customer service unable remedy issue advised send repair received fedex shipment box label made offer repair returned approximately three day later along message technician claiming nothing wrong themi tested phone wife phone microphone phone would detect sound high volume sound still garbled phoned customer service department representative advised take local store explain problem professional unfortunately nearest store hour away house however agent appear find issuei expressed unhappiness drive hour round trip fix equipment inquired could send back repair determining specific problem agent agreed send another shipping box note problem microphone repair ticket got another package sent repair second time waited gave back said nothing wrong microphone working properlyat point wondering world valuable company would consider appropriate force client spend hour time repairing product rather shipping new pair keeping consumer satisfied customer service tarnished might fantastic device

reviews: even though im sure to keep my airpods clean, after a year, so much earwax has been jammed into the airpods that audio is significantly quieter. not worth the money. no noise cancellation which is pretty standard at the end of . battery is great. the airpods last for a long time but the case starts to deplete faster as you use them. the microphone is horrible. if i had a dollar for everytime i was told i couldnt be heard, i would probably have airpods pros anyway. i feel there are better options than these. if you want to spend some extra money, the airpods pros are a good choice. silicone tips (which would prevent the earwax issue), great noise cancellation, better microphones, recent. conclusion is, theyre great for about a year but unless you do not produce earwax, they start to get quieter.

reviews: i bought these so i could listen to music while out on walks with my dog and zoom calls. after using them for a few months, i have some thoughts on this. i have a pair of over the head headphones that are noise cancelling. they were cheap relative to the air pods and they deliver great sounds when i play music on them. the airpods were only okay at x the price of the headphone. they do not fall out of my ear while walking or jogging as some people have reported, but if i go to tuck my hair behind my ear or rest my head on something, they fall out because of the long tail it has on them. the airpod pro looks like it would sit better in your ear and not get easily knocked out since it has a much shorter tail. all that said, i tried cheaper blue tooth ear pods and they were terrible and kept disconnecting from my phone so i gave this  stars because the sound is good enough for walks and stays connected to the bluetooth.  the battery life for using it for calls is pretty short (around  hours) but i have never run the battery out on them listening to music. the wireless charging case recharges them very fast and i consider that a huge plus. the airpod pro is likely much better but i would still buy these over the airpod  just because of the huge price difference.
cleaned_review: bought could listen music walk dog zoom call using month thought pair head headphone noise cancelling cheap relative air pod deliver great sound play music okay x price headphone fall ear walking jogging people reported go tuck hair behind ear rest head something fall long tail airpod pro look like would sit better ear get easily knocked since much shorter tail said tried cheaper blue tooth ear pod terrible kept disconnecting phone gave star sound good enough walk stay connected bluetooth battery life using call pretty short around hour never run battery listening music wireless charging case recharges fast consider huge plus airpod pro likely much better would still buy airpod huge price difference

reviews: star because although they are amazing, i am now on my th pair in  years.i bought my airpod nd gen directly from apple (not on amazon).  my first pair had the microphones go out, but i did not realize it until just after the  month warranty expired.  i just thought siri sucked and could not figure out what i was asking.  had i realized it was a microphone issue in time, i would have been under warranty.  however, when i finally realized the microphones fully quit working, they would not replace them (days past warranty).  soon after this the speakers on one side started going out.  i had to adjust the iphone sound settings to have less sound go to one ear so they balanced out and then up the volume.  at this point i decided i would get a new pair because i use them all the time and need sound and microphones working.so, i bought a second pair.  fast forward several months and the microphones quit working on this pair.  this time i call for warranty asap.  they checked things over with me and replaced them.  to apple is credit, it was single day shipping and quick turnaround.so, onto my third pair.  about - months in with my third pair, the microphones quit working.  wth.  i am so careful with these things and have no clue how or why this could possibly be happening.  i was so busy working at the time i waited to contact support (thought the new pair would have typical  year functional warranty expectations).  well i was wrong there.  spent a long time with apple support and learned that the replacements are only covered for the remainder of your original pairs warranty (or  days if your previous pair were under that time remaining).  so, they only guarantee the replacements will function properly for the time remaining on your previous product warranty?  i get that they do not want people seeking a brand new product every year through minor warranty claims, but what if the replacement product legit fails in a short period of time?after being escalated to senior support staff at apple and some more discussions, they ultimately agreed to make an exception and provide me a warranty replacement pair.  sent them in and they confirmed the issue and replaced quickly.  again, quick turnaround with warranty shipping.so, onto my fourth pair.  everything works great, but it is only been a few days.i love the airpods.  they sound great.  i prefer earbuds that do not "plug" my ear and these fit my ears well.  only real issues have been those mentioned above.  another issue has been battery life.  it is great when they are newer.  normally, they notify you when they are running low several times before powering off.  as they get older, i will get that low battery sound and then they immediately shut down.the airpods have amazing reviews and ratings by thousands, so i am shocked i cannot find anyone else having issues with microphones like i am.  they are great when they work, but i have had tough luck getting them to work correctly for more than a year.update on th pair multistop  less than  months into the th pair and people were occasionally having trouble hearing me in conversations.  i isolated the left vs right mic in the settings and figured out the the right airpod microphone is going out (distant soft sound and cutting in and out).  did not notice earlier because the left still works fine and it must autoselect that mic most of the time.  called apple and looks like i am still in the  day warranty on replaced items (thankfully i caught it in time), so it looks like i may be able to get the right one replaced.  will have to again send the entire case and both airpods into their service center first to have them checked.i put these in my ears.  i put them back in the case.  i really do not understand how each pair could keep having this issue.

reviews: my wife purchased these for me as a gift in august  and they worked great up until about a month ago.  at that time, the right ear bud microphone began to fail and would no longer detect sound unless i was yelling.  i contacted customer support at apple and worked through all of the potential resolutions such as updating to the newest ios (.) and confirming that the airpods were running the most recent firmware.  when customer support was not able to resolve the issue they suggested that i send the airpods in for repair.  i received a shipping box and label for fedex and sent them offer for repair.  the airpods arrived back at my home about  days later with a note from the technicians stating that there was nothing wrong with them.  i then tested them again on my phone and my wife is phone, and with both phones the right microphone would only detect sound at a loud volume (i.e. yelling) and yet still garbled.  again i contacted customer support at apple.  this time the agent suggested that the next step would be to take the airpods to the nearest apple store so that i could demonstrate the issue for a technician there.  unfortunately the nearest apple store is . hours from my home, though this did not seem to be an inconvenience in the eyes of the agent.  at this point, i stated that it did not make sense to drive  hours round-trip to repair a $ device, and i questioned why i could not send them back for repair while identifying the exact issue.  the agent agreed to send another shipping box and to include on the repair "ticket" that the issue was with the right microphone.  so multistop  (can you guess where this is going?) i received another box, sent the airpods a nd time for repair, and waited.  again, they returned them to me and stated that nothing was wrong with them.  and again, the right microphone still does not function correctly.  at this point i am left wondering why the "world is most valuable company" would find it acceptable to ask a customer to take  hours of his/her time to fix apple is product, instead of simply sending a replacement pair and keeping the customer happy.  apple is product support has ruined what could be a great product.

reviews: this product has been nothing but trouble. first, the right earpiece is louder than the left, and there is no way to adjust this. at least i do not think there is: it came without any directions at all. a great deal of time on the internet found no solution.  there are no actual buttons, it is "touch" control, which means any time you adjust its position in your ear it turns itself off, or the volume changes, or it pauses whatever your listening to.  lately, the left earpiece turns itself off spontaneously, without being touched, after a few minutes. if you can manage to communicate that you want it turn back on, it will turn back on for - sometimes - up to an entire minute.  if the two earpieces become unsynced, the only way to get them both back is to stop what you are doing, place them back in the case, and remove them again. and no, they are fully charged.  it is not just that the device is fractious. it is designed poorly, since it is not obvious how to control it through various touch patterns and again, there were no directions included. ( multiexclamation )  maybe i got a bad set, but my advice is to look elsewhere for a more utile design.

reviews: i received these headphones as a christmas gift from a relative. my first choice have not been apple airpods but beats. however, accepting a free gift is always fun. until you get fake apple headphones from a third party vendor on amazon.on the first connect, everything seemed fine. i sat them down for a second and went to use them again. my phone started freezing and glitching. when i attempted to turn my phone off bc my phone would not disconnect from them, i had an extremely hard time. i connected them to another device and they did the same thing.i went into the apple store here recently and discovered that the serial number on the box as listed in the photo have been reprinted on tons of apple made boxes by the third party host using true apple airpods serial numbers. they showed me the list.this is highly disappointing and discrediting to apple and also amazon.if you purchase anything with a name brand on it especially apple, please take your products to the main distributor to have them vip firm that you have made a legit purchase if you care about the quality of your product.no, i will not be removing my review. please handle this accordingly.

reviews: as most apple products are, these work pretty well. i know this is not the case for everyone, but these fit in my ears perfectly and comfortably. i can wear them for hours at a time without noticing them. i have been using these with an android phone with some interesting results.things i love about them:- how quickly they connect. these things connect almost immediately once you open the lid for the case!- you can use either one on their own if you want, it does not matter which- the call quality is fantastic! i love taking calls on these things!- the range is pretty great. i can set my phone down and walk around nearby rooms most of the time without any issue.things i do not love:- the audio quality is alright. it is about the same as the wired earpods. not bad, but nothing amazing.- it is too easy to hear what is going on around me. they have no noise cancellation whatsoever. i could literally carry on full conversations with people while listening to these if i wanted.- connectivity issues. the range is usually good, but sometimes the connectivity is awful. i can walk around with my phone in my pocket and put my hand over my phone, and these will skip in and out. sometimes they will even get out of sync a little bit. this has happened extensively. i made a warranty claim on them and apple said they could not find any problems so they sent them back, and i still have those issues. i also wonder how much this has to do with my phone though, because my phone (samsung galaxy s) bluetooth does not seem the strongest sometimes.if you have an iphone, i would recommend giving them a go. but i think there are definitely better deals out there.

reviews: ive tried a variety of earbuds, i finally broke down and bought the airpods but i do not feel like they are worth it. i mean theyre fine, but they do not work well for running multistop  they do not fall out but moisture (sweat) causes them to to disconnect because their sensors malfunction, i do not know if thats just me and its not like my ears are actually sweating inside its just sweat coming from my head. they do not have the functions that other earbuds have (like tap for next/pause/volume) and the stress of worrying about losing them is overwhelming! theyre perfectly fine for walking and sitting and i often find that i forget i have them in because theyre relatively comfortable. but its easy to knock them out and if you lay down they can shift and disconnect again because the sensors arent touching your ear on both sides of the earbud. if you think you can use these earbuds and wear earmuffs at the same time (ear protection for loud machinery) think again! the lightest touch can knock one out then your audio stops and youre left with an earbud in the earmuff. the noise cancellation is fine, im a female who generally only has one in at a time for safety reasons, and the sound is fine. ive had better sound from cheaper earbuds. im sure all of these things are unique to the user, maybe my ears are weirdly shaped, maybe i sweat more than most people. it just doesnt feel like theyre worth the money. on a positive note, theyre great for phone calls.
cleaned_review: ive tried variety earbuds finally broke bought feel like worth mean theyre fine work well running multistop fall moisture sweat cause disconnect sensor malfunction know thats like ear actually sweating inside sweat coming head function earbuds like tap nextpausevolume stress worrying losing overwhelming theyre perfectly fine walking sitting often find forget theyre relatively comfortable easy knock lay shift disconnect sensor arent touching ear side earbud think use earbuds wear earmuff time ear protection loud machinery think lightest touch knock audio stop youre earbud earmuff noise cancellation fine im female generally time safety reason sound fine ive better sound cheaper earbuds im sure thing unique user maybe ear weirdly shaped maybe sweat people doesnt feel like theyre worth money positive note theyre great phone call

reviews: i finally made the switch to airpods from my  jabra elite t and it most certainly been a downgrade.  here are my reasons for feeling so:. battery life is atrocious.  with daily use i would charge my jabra is once a week.  they had excellent battery life and the charge case was great with keeping them ready to go.  with my airpods i have to charge daily.  full being fully charged i took them on an hour bike ride and maybe used sporadically throughout the day and by night i had the warning of only having % battery, after being in the case multistop   sound quality is mediocre.  the jabra is fit in-ear and had an element of noise cancellation.  the airpods sit in your ear but have no noise cancellation.  aside from that, the my old jabra is had far superior sound.  there is not much else to say, they are just better than the airpods here multistop  price.  i paid $ for the nd gen airpods at best buy.  i think they are down to $ now on amazon.  the newer model of jabra elite (the t) is currently $ on jabra is website.  airpods are severely overpriced for what you get and i have the feeling if you looped in other competitors (bose, sony, sennheiser, klipsch) you would find similar results.overall the one pro i will give the airpods is connectivity.  i own an iphone, ipod, and imac and the airpods connect very quickly to apple products.  i have been an apple user since the early s so they have gotten their money out of me from brand loyalty but their quality has really dropped in recent years.  i think the only reason they continue to get glowing reviews is based on this loyalty to them.  i would strongly encourage anyone looking at these airpods to check out some of the competitors first.  you will find vastly superior earbuds for the same or lower price.  but on the other hand you will not be one of the cool kids with white buds hanging off your earlobes.
cleaned_review: finally made switch jabra elite certainly downgrade reason feeling battery life atrocious daily use would charge jabra week excellent battery life charge case great keeping ready go charge daily full fully charged took hour bike ride maybe used sporadically throughout day night warning battery case multistop sound quality mediocre jabra fit inear element noise cancellation sit ear noise cancellation aside old jabra far superior sound much else say better multistop price paid nd gen best buy think amazon newer model jabra elite currently jabra website severely overpriced get feeling looped competitor bose sony sennheiser klipsch would find similar resultsoverall pro give connectivity iphone ipod imac connect quickly product user since early gotten money brand loyalty quality really dropped recent year think reason continue get glowing review based loyalty would strongly encourage anyone looking check competitor first find vastly superior earbuds lower price hand cool kid white bud hanging earlobe

reviews: airpods are definitely very convenient to use, especially if you like to listen to music or videos while youre working/moving around. sound quality is standard and pretty much the same as the wired earbuds. the battery life is really good and you could listen for the entire day relatively uninterrupted if you use one airpod and swap when the battery runs low. even when i do not use them for several days, the battery doesnt drain so they can last a long while if you leave them around. however, theres a frustrating issue that ive encountered more times than should be acceptable for rather highly priced earbuds. this is mostly relevant if you tend to only use one earbud at a time though; its not a major issue if you normally use both at the same time.the first pair i ordered came brand new and sealed, but within a few hours, they had already stopped working properly. the right airpod would not connect unless the left was also in use. troubleshooting guides suggested resetting the airpods, reconnecting, testing on other devices, and etc., but nothing fixed the issue, and it was consistent throughout multiple devices (iphone, ipad, pc). i ended up returning these and requesting a replacement.the second pair i received, which is the one i currently own, worked fine for the first couple weeks. however, the issue from the previous pair started occurring with these as well. i decided to keep these despite the problem because unlike the first set, these seemed to function properly at least sometimes, so they werent consistently dysfunctional. resetting the airpods also temporarily resolves the issue, but this isnt the most convenient thing to do when it . happens rather frequently (pretty much daily) and . i have a case, and you need to hold onto the button on the back of the charging case to reset/reconnect. also, weirdly enough, this pair had the connection issues with both airpods. sometimes the right wouldnt work without the left, and other times the left wouldnt work without the right. its probably a weird coincidence, but it always seems like the one i want to use at any given moment is the earbud that doesnt want to connect without the other.anyway, i kept the second pair because they were functioning well enough, and i had purchased them for $ which i guess isnt too awful for brand new and legitimate apple airpods. but if the price was higher and i knew about this connectivity issue, which seems to be rather common judging from all the troubleshooting forums i found, i probably wouldnt make the purchase.
cleaned_review: definitely convenient use especially like listen music video youre workingmoving around sound quality standard pretty much wired earbuds battery life really good could listen entire day relatively uninterrupted use airpod swap battery run low even use several day battery doesnt drain last long leave around however there frustrating issue ive encountered time acceptable rather highly priced earbuds mostly relevant tend use earbud time though major issue normally use timethe first pair ordered came brand new sealed within hour already stopped working properly airpod would connect unless also use troubleshooting guide suggested resetting reconnecting testing device etc nothing fixed issue consistent throughout multiple device iphone ipad pc ended returning requesting replacementthe second pair received currently worked fine first couple week however issue previous pair started occurring well decided keep despite problem unlike first set seemed function properly least sometimes werent consistently dysfunctional resetting also temporarily resolve issue isnt convenient thing happens rather frequently pretty much daily case need hold onto button back charging case resetreconnect also weirdly enough pair connection issue sometimes wouldnt work without time wouldnt work without probably weird coincidence always seems like want use given moment earbud doesnt want connect without otheranyway kept second pair functioning well enough purchased guess isnt awful brand new legitimate price higher knew connectivity issue seems rather common judging troubleshooting forum found probably wouldnt make purchase

reviews: i really debated between these and the pro version but ultimately, i did not feel i needed the adjustable fit or the full noise cancellation. i am so happy with this purchase! the battery life is great (longer lasting than the pro version actually), charging is a breeze, small and compact so they go with me everywhere. i love them. i am sure the wireless ones and the pro ones are really good, but these still hold their own in my opinion and are a great price for anyone who does not need the features of the pro version. i think wireless charging is kind of a gimmick anyway so i do not care about that in the least. i wish i would bought them sooner.update: ive now been using these for -months and i took off one star because they do not connect and switch seamlessly between my ipad and iphone, which is the main reason i purchased these over a different brand. also, they often do not auto-connect to even one of them to start with. they are supposed to connect as soon as you put them in your ears to whichever of your devices is activated or whichever one you used last (you can adjust that in settings) but they do not. i often have to go into the settings and manually connect them. they also often only connect in one ear - hugely annoying! ive had them randomly disconnect when on a phone call or watching something as well. they worked great for about six months but now i constantly have issues with them so im looking at purchasing another pair of wireless earbuds from a recognizable brand that is known for their sound quality. sorry, apple.

reviews: i bought these to be able to run and listen to music without carrying a phone.  apple claims that their handoff feature allows airpods connected to the iphone to hand off a connection to an apple watch when you go beyond bluetooth range from the phone.  this never works.  you either have to take the phone along, or turn off the phone, then pair with the watch, and then leave.another problem is that after maybe - minutes, the music sometimes stalls and needs to be restarted, but invariably only one channel comes back (and sometimes neither one).  very annoying.  this tends to happen more in cooler weather, even with a hat on that covers the ears.beyond those two issues (which are enough to make me not recommend the air pods, at least if you plan to use them like i do), everything is ok.  sound is ok for non-noise-cancelling earphones; not great frequency response, but for this type of earphone you cannot expect a lot.  they fit nicely and do not tend to fall out of the ear.  battery life is also pretty good, at least for my purposes; i can run for a couple of hours and change and they are still working (unless they do not, as described above, but that is not the battery).  the apple watch runs out of juice before the earphones.

reviews: i really want to like them. they are supposed to be effortlessly convenient to pair and use for all your apple devices while sounding and looking good. but they are not multistop they are none of that. let me explain:sound - it is ok, really. no seal so you hear all the ambient noise around you which is good and bad depending on the situation. not much for bass extension, treble is flat but clear. adequate all things considered. if you have used the old design earpods, these are nearly the same sound profile. on a plus, the microphones are very good.features - very little to say here. they are bluetooth (.) so they pair quickly and have long range, when they work (more on that later).battery life - very good, a couple hours at high-ish volume on the pods and half a dozen charges per case charge. more than i need for most situations.functionality - % atrocious and i have had  sets of these (shame on me). the case and charging system is so faulty it leads to numerous other problems with pairing and connecting both airpods at the same time. the contact points in the case and on the pods where they charge easily loses connection, dirties, and later corrodes. using them for fitness around any sweat or moisture will speed up their inevitable failure. once this happens, one pod will refuse to charge or stay connected when put back in the case, draining it is battery or trying to reconnect to different devices when in the case. even if they did not suffer constant bugs, the pairing with multiple devices is equally buggy, frequently losing connection or trying to connect to other devices in the house for no apparent reason.as far as i can tell, airpods pro share the same charging design, so i will listen to my own advice and stay far away from these until the design is fixed. i would advise you do the same.

reviews: buyer beware!  i ordered these apple airpods, which are sold by amazon and not a third party.  they arrived in perfect condition and sealed box. however, i called apple customer support and spoke with an apple representative to confirm they were true apple and not fake.  in order to confirm this i asked about the serial number on the box, then compared to the serial number on the charging case, right earbud, and left earbud. they have three different serial numbers!  that confirms the suspicion, these are not a matched set!  they have been tampered with and then resealed to make it look like a new product. at best these are used, seconds, or refurbished and mismatched when putting the set together. i am returning multistop do not pay this price for refurbished.  also notice the description does not disclose this. this is fraud.

reviews: i own a pixel xl for personal but have an iphone  for business as does my wife. i ordered the air pods ) because they were on sales and, ) for business calls expecting high end quality as apple is known for. first, the quality build of the product is excellent. they connect easily to bluetooth and i must say i found the sound quality better than expected. however, the lack of a rubberized "ear piece" causes them to sit on the ear rather than in it. this diminishes noise cancellation. it also feels like they will fall out if i move around too much but admittedly, that is a personal preference and based on my ear "anatomy". what surprised me most (and disappointed) was the short battery life compared to other non-apple ear pods i have owned. the specs say -hours (which is short to begin with) but tests reviews i have read say . hours at best. not for me. i am barely getting -hours. so for someone who is constantly on conference calls, i am forced to switch back to the wired ear pods. and when one considers what apple charges $. plus (when not on sale) for this and all its products, the value just is not there. unless you are an apple fanatic, there are better wireless ear pods on the market that offer a better value.

reviews: if i had not authenticated the serial number, i would seriously think i was sold a counterfeit product.  since this is an authentic, new product, i am just left to believe the product is mediocre at best.i regularly use my air pods on both ios and android devices. the air pods connect relatively quickly and easily to both, but especially with other apple devices. (for some reason, the max volume is significantly lower on my android device.) the bluetooth range is not great with reception starting to break up if you move more than -' away from the phone.  the sound is pretty clear, but less than  weeks after purchase, individual ear buds will cut in and out or get static-y even while sitting stationary next to my phone.  like other reviewers, my individual ear buds do not seem to charge evenly with one often dying well before the second.  i have also been disappointed with the battery performance. the ear buds re-charge quickly when inserted into the case and i would say i can probably get  hours of run time between charges of the *case*, but i struggle to regularly get more than  hours of run time per full charge of the ear buds (and oftentimes not even that).  finally, i have no idea how people wear these all the time as i found the shape of the air pods to be tremendously uncomfortable.  (though i am aware accessories exist to mitigate this issue)i truly do not understand the effuse praise heaped upon air pods. i am deeply underwhelmed.

reviews: i never liked the idea of apple getting rid of the headphone jack but never knew why.now i know. it was not to make space for more tech in the phone. it was to boost the sales of bluetooth headphones. and it worked. apple made a lot of money.i got mine and i really liked them. i also have  dollar wired earphones. i have had them both for about  years. the airpods no longer have a  hour battery. it has a  one hour battery per charge. i called apple to ask about getting a replacement. they said it was  bucks per airpod. i said, i might as well buy a new pair.that is when it hit me. apple is making money with the increase in sales for bluetooth headphones but also insuring that people will come back to buy more when the battery no longer holds a charge. they know this. i do not know about you, but if i pay over  dollars for some headphones. i want it to last more than  years. my wired earphones work like the day i bought them.this is diabolically evil of apple.i am telling you this as a warning. if you buy bluetooth headohones, be prepared to buy a new set in - years because the battery will inevitably die.

reviews: mixed feelings on this item.  i have a pair that i have had for about a year and a half that still work well.  i only use them a few times a week, but other than the fact that they constantly fall out of my ears, i like them.  if i was not able to find the aftermarket silicone ear hooks that i need to use to keep them from falling out all the time, i would have returned them and give them a  star rating.  to be fair, i have small ears.  so, i would consider another option if you have small ears.  that said, this review is for a second pair i bought as a gift.  unfortunately, after  months the right pod would not charge/work at all.  the left one would work, but only for about  min.  if fully charged and left in the charging case, both the case and the working pod would completely drain, which implies the batteries are not good in the case or the pod(s).  the person i bought these for did not tell me about the problems until several months after she noticed it.  so, i had her give them to me and contacted apple.  support was really good and they tried to help me get them to work over the phone.  unfortunately, no luck.  so, i asked what my options were to get them replaced or fixed.  they said they were out of warrantee and it would cost over $ +$ sandh to get them repaired.  i paid under $ for them, so naturally all i could say was thanks for the help multistop   i guess i will just throw these in the trash.  there are a lot of options out there that are a lot less pricy.  so, i will replace the gift, since i do not like to give a gift that is defective.  however, i may look at the samsung or a couple of others that are out there.  again, the ones i own still work fine.  this pair was obviously just a "lemon", but since apple was not willing to do anything, i have a bad taste in my mouth.  pretty disappointed with apple.  such good service, but will not stand behind their products.  do not even get me started about the easy-break glass on their phones and pads.

reviews: i was hesitant to purchase airpods because of the steep price so when i saw there was a deal a few months ago (early ) i hopped on the bandwagon! since i have many apple products, these do make it easier to sync up to my macbook, iphone and ipad. however, even with that being the case the airpods i received were defective. i spent hours talking to customer service and at the apple store (pre-covid) and they ended up having to replace the case and one of the airpods. at times i still have issues with connectivity and the microphone is not the greatest. sometimes my airpods would be in the case and i was not trying to connect to my phone yet the music would play while they were in the case. i even reported this to the apple care team and my customer service representative told me it was something they would never seen or heard about before. (seriously wish i was making this up, i just wanted to be able to have wireless earbuds).i will admit that i do not fully regret my purchase, but regret buying it via amazon instead of from the apple store or a major retailer (i.e. best buy). not sure if my logic makes sense, but i feel like there would have have been less of a chance of getting a faulty item.tlr; airpods are not a bad investment, but be wary and monitor your item if you buy it via amazon. also they are not noise cancelling and the microphone is not the greatest. the sound is ok but if you want to still spend a good amount of money, you probably can get better quality headphones elsewhere. the best feature to me is that it is super connected with my apple products and i can tap to change the songs, etc.

reviews: in order to determine whether or not these airpods were real, i immediately checked to see if the serial number matched apple is official website. the number could not be verified. after opening the box, i noticed two things: "the designed by apple in california" was black, not grey, and inside the case were small black particles. not only was it until i visited helpful websites that explain how to spot fake airpods that i knew these were fake. please do not be fooled by the packaging!of course, this does not mean that all airpods from amazon are fake. a friend of mine purchased them from here last year and hers was verifiable. so, i think it is a case-by-case situation. make sure to do some research once you receive the package!overall, i was looking so forward to finally purchasing my first airpods, but the end result was very dismaying and disappointing. although it would cost more, to play it safe, i would recommend purchasing from the official website!
