indeed airpods work great with apple products. if that is all you are going to use them for, do not hesitate. i have bought and returned  other airbud products. primary issue was the device staying in the ear, then sound quality.  airpods stay in your ears and the sound is very good for the price point.however multistop i am primarily interested in wireless help with hearing especially my tvs.  i do not have apple tv. one tv is a smart samsung with bluetooth and the other is panasonic that i have added a bluetooth transmitter.  anything that is not apple has no issue pairing with the tvs.  when it comes to pairing the airpods, my blood pressure rises each time. sometimes they pair, sometimes not.  but that is not the real issue.  the airpods do not have independent sound control. if you are using an apple device, you control the sound through the device like phone, watch etc.  however, my tvs (two major brands) do not have volume control for output. very few tvs do.  so if the volume is too high or too low, i need to disconnect from the tv, pair with an apple device, get the volume where i think i want it, then disconnect, then re-pair with the tv and hope the volume is somewhere near where i like it.i spoke with apple about this and their response is buy an apple tv device. that way the airpod will pair and sound can be controlled. in my case, i would need to buy  apple tv devices.  the low priced airbuds come with volume control, apparently there is not any technology magic required.  apple is choosing to not include.i am still undecided about returning the airpods. the fit, comfort and sound are well worth the price. the volume annoyance is a reminder each time i use these things that apple is not the customer focused/design company we think they are.  before i bought the airpods, i spoke with  friends who use and highly recommend.  each one told me i would be able to control the volume with my iphone or ipad. after talking with apple, that is not the case.while on that subject, since my last apple purchase this is the first time in about  months that i have needed to talk with apple support.  what has happened over there?  four calls in two weeks; each time i feel like i am speaking with someone that is just reading a script and does not really understand the issue.  the solution to most any issue seems to be, buy something else apple.  as a long time shareholder who is gone through a lot of stock splits, i appreciate the focus on apple products but come on, there is more solutions to improving an apple product than buying another apple product.

reviews: update: i have had these for six months and the case has stopped charging. they are essentially useless now. i would recommend purchasing through apple so you can get another pair if yours malfunctions. since i purchased on here and the return window is closed, i cannot get another pair, which means $ down the drain.this was definitely one of my best amazon purchases. the sound quality on these is amazing even during phone calls. the charging case holds an impressive amount of charge so i only need to recharge it once every - days, which is not very much considering i use these - hours a day.at work. that being said, there are some cons to these. the battery life of the airpods themselves is not the best-- you will get - hours max. now, five minutes in the charging case will get these back to full charge, so take that with a grain of salt. the biggest con for me has been the bluetooth connectivity. i have an iphone  so i would expect these to have no issues with connecting. however, every few times i use these, one or both of the airpods does not connect when i pull it out of the case. it usually takes about five minutes to figure out the problem and re-connect them. it is definitely a problem when i am trying to pick up a call on my airpods or listen to something quickly. for that reason, i would give these / stars. they are still worth the purchase but i would recommend adding applecare so you can get a replacement if you have the same issues. (p.s. if you have an apple watch, these do not connect independently to the apple watch, you will need to have your iphone on you.)

reviews: disappointed. i wanted to love these airpods. the sound is perfect. zero complaints with the sound quality. however, these really hurt. they should not cause you pain. when i say hurt, it is truly painful! this is not a mild discomfort. i tried to ignore it the first day, but after a few tries it is miserable. i tried barely placing them in my ear and adjusting it, it relieved some of the pain pressure but it still hurt. they keep falling out too multiexclamation  so if you adjust it to barely go into your ear, hopefully you are not moving around and working out because these will fall out repeatedly disrupting your workout. i am so surprised at how badly these airpods have turned out to be. they are expensive! if i had known, i never would have spent this much money. i saw others using them and just thought they would be great. they cause pain and fall out repeatedly. you would think that someone could design something better. i need to find something better! no sound is worth all of this suffering. my ears and head hurt hours after i remove these. yes, it causes headaches. its so sad, because they have terrific sound and they look cool too. this is a big disappointment. my advice: do not waste your money.

reviews: the loudness of calendar alerts is a deal-breaker.  it is maximum volume and seriously likely to damage your hearing and/or give you a heart attack.  when the alert goes off you claw at your skull to rip these out of your ears it is that bad.  i have thrown them across the room.this is a known bug with these.i researched this for days and the best i found was one method to adjust volume (kill all apps, reduce volume, use as normal( but as soon as you adjust the volume through a different app or on another set of bluetooth speakers, it goes back to maximum.there is no practical way to control this.if you use your airpods and phone for business and have a lot of calendar alerts, the airpods suck.on the positive side, the sound is pretty good.they also charge very rapidly in the case - very pleasantly surprised at that.  i get about  -  charges from the case is battery before that has to be recharged.the feature for checking the battery on your iphone by opening the case near the phone is also very cool.if they could fix the calendar bug they would be / rated.

reviews: my son talked me into buying airpods. they seemed kind of superfluous. an expensive and possibly of limited value item. but i liked the idea of getting a greater range of uses with my apple watch.now i do not go anywhere without them. they sync with my watch in a few seconds. i now listen to more podcasts and have made numerous phone calls with great ease. i use them with my iphone when i want to listen to music without disturbing anyone. when i walk my dog, i use one pod so that i can walk her safely, and i find that to be quite satisfactory. the design is wonderful and functional. the case feels solid and is easy to carry in pants pockets. finally, the sound quality is outstanding, far exceeding my expectations. theyre not cheap, but you have to pay a little more for such an exemplary product. update: over time my opinion re this product has changed. i have found that airpods are painful to wear to more than a handful of minutes. they fall out of my ears with any vigorous  physical activity. additionally, the amount of time that they hold a charge is inferior to many earbuds that cost far less. because the sound quality is excellent, i still give it three stars.

reviews: we have been so tired of using clunky headphones or the terrible fall-out all the time  earbuds apple provides, that we thought we would order the air pods.we have lots of apple products - an ipad, a macbook pro, and a couple i phones.we are not luddites, but we are not super computer savvy either - we do not program for instance.i was excited to give these a try.  if you can get them to work, the sound is beautiful and clear.  it was relatively easy to pair the pods to the iphones.  but, we still cannot pair them to the ipad, and though we have had the ear pods for a week, we have only been able to pair them with the macbook pro one time.they come in a small package like a dental floss container.  as it turns out, there is a teeny tiny button to press on the back of the container.  it is well disguised.  they could have done something better so that your hand could feel the teeny tiny indent button, but i had to use a magnifying glass and strong light to discover it.  they should paint it with a red dot.  the only time i got the macbook pro to work, i had to get on my i phone and select the air pods there.some things to know:  when you are trying to pair, make sure your ear pods are in the case and that the case is well charged.  then open the case and press the invisible button. look inside the case and see if the inner tiny light has changed from green to flashing white.  if the case is flashing, place the case near the item you want to pair with.  make sure your iphone is de-selected and maybe your air pods will pair with your ipad or macbook pro.  maybe,does not it seem like a big company like apple could have made these more user friendly?we tried about  u tube videos trying to get these to work.

reviews: i feel like i got scammed! advertisement and the sale for the airpods nd gen is as follows: one pair wireless charging more expensive, they second pair cheaper and plug in. the way you choose your airpods from this seller is the same so its easy to come to the assumption that both are nd gen. so i feel like the labeling was on purpose to sale (obsolete merchandise) which cost me money and i ended up buying a product i didnt want. i feel taken advantage of as a consumer ive never owned airpods because theyre pricey however being that my ipad and my iphone have different charging ports its hard to have just one pair of headphones for them i broke down and decided it was worth the convenience. its sellers like this one that made me want to buy directly from the website and as soon as amazon reopens its call center i plan to make a full complaint. please know what youre buying be careful today sellers will take advantage of consumers with no sense of guilt after all its nothing but profit for them. i gave this product three stars because it is an apple product it was in new condition although it was not what i thought i purchased. do not trust amazon to make sellers sell quality products, not everything you buy comes from them. the pair i current own work fine but i just paid  plus tax for first generation multiexclamation  get me once shame on you multiexclamation

reviews: i am an apple fan and really wanted to like these! multistop quick take -- convenient, but uncomfortable, too quiet, only one control, and not water-resistantthe setup and automatic pairing make these really convenient to use. however, for the apple premium price, there are a few things that just come up way too short for me:- build quality is poor, leaving sharp edges where the plastic pieces meet. this gets really painful when you are taking them in and out throughout the day (i have tried  pairs, thinking i might have got a dud, and only  of the  pods had smooth edges).- the only control is double-tap. this is apple -- i would expect a few more touch options. cannot control volume.- way too quiet. it also seems obvious that pods that have no isolation or noise cancelling (for the sake of the design, which i understand) should have a lot of headroom for volume. not the case with these.- not even water resistant, which is really disappointing. i am nervous walking with them if it is raining or snowing. we have the technology multistop
